title: 115_s257
content: The Act may be cited as the "Acadia National Park Boundary Clarification Act" and it clarifies the boundary of Acadia National Park. The Acadia National Park Boundary Clarification Act amends Public Law 99-420 to confirm the boundary of the Park includes approximately 1,441 acres of land on the Schoodic Peninsula. The Acadia National Park Boundary Clarification Act ratifies and approves the acquisition and alteration of land by the United States as of specific dates. SEC. 3. LIMITATION ON LAND ACQUISITION FOR ACADIA NATIONAL PARK: The Secretary of the Interior can only acquire land within Acadia National Park or in Hancock or Knox County, Maine, as per Public Law 99-420. Exchanges for land are allowed under certain conditions. SEC. 4. SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT. SEC. 4. SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT: Amends Public Law 99-420 to allocate $350,000 to a regional consortium for improving solid waste management on Mount Desert Island, Maine. SEC. 5. ACADIA NATIONAL PARK ADVISORY COMMISSION: Secretary to reestablish and appoint members to the Advisory Commission. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF CERTAIN PROVISIONS RELATING TO ACADIA NATIONAL PARK. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF CERTAIN PROVISIONS RELATING TO ACADIA NATIONAL PARK. Repeals sections from Acts of 1919 and 1929. SEC. 7. MODIFICATION OF USE RESTRICTION. Amends Act of 1950 to allow conveyance of land in Acadia National Park for public purposes, with conditions to protect park resources. SEC. 8 amends Title I of Public Law 99-420 to allow traditional harvesting of marine organisms in Acadia National Park in accordance with Maine state laws. SEC. 9 involves the conveyance of certain land in Acadia National Park to the town of Bar Harbor, Maine. The Secretary shall convey a .29-acre parcel of land in Acadia National Park to the Town of Bar Harbor for a solid waste transfer facility. If the land is used for a different purpose, it may revert to the United States.
